eci_method(7) Miscellaneous Information Manual eci_method(7)

NAME

eci_method - eComInit method conventions

DESCRIPTION

A number of restarters, including the main restarter in eci.startd(8), support supervision semantics based on UNIX® processes. Such restarters share a set of imported properties and conventions for process management which are defined herein.

METHOD DEFINITION

A method is defined as a page-type property. The following subproperties of that page are accepted:

exec string

The command to be executed. Note that this is not passed to a shell; if you wish to make use of the capabilities of a shell, you must invoke a shell explicitly.

If the command is prefixed with `-` then the exit code is ignored, and treated as if it was 0.

timeout integer optional

Generally denotes the maximum time for which this method will be allowed to run. Exact meaning is restarter-defined; please see the relevant restarter's manual page for details.

ENVIRONMENT VARIABLES

A number of variables are defined by restarters for a method's environment.
